intro: Vincentia celle, commonly known as the purple morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant purple or blue blooms that open in the morning and close at dusk. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Vincentia celle is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
